ConditionalExpression.description: Conditional expression supporting complex logical operations (AND, OR, NOT) and field comparisons

anyOf.description: Logical AND operator - combines multiple conditions with AND logic
Logical OR operator - combines multiple conditions with OR logic
Logical NOT operator - negates a condition
Array operator for 'in'/'notIn': { field: ['in', [values]] } - checks if field value is/isn't in the list
Comparison operator with scalar value: { field: ['operator', value] } - comparison operators (==, !=, >, <, >=, <=)
String operators: { field: ['contains'|'startswith'|'endswith', value] } - text-based comparisons
Simplified 'in' operator: { field: [values] } - implicit 'in', field value must be one of the listed values. NOT supported with nested arrays.
Simple equality: { field: value } - field value equals the specified value

ComputedRule.description: Form-level computed rule for automatic scoring in exams/quizzes. Two types: 'field' evaluates individual answers against correct values, 'aggregate' calculates total scores and assigns grades. Required properties: id, name, type. For field type also use: fieldName, subtype, correctAnswer, points. For aggregate type also use: inputFields, evaluationRules.

id.description: Unique identifier for the computed rule (e.g., 'q1_eval', 'total_score')

name.description: Descriptive name for the computed rule (REQUIRED)

type.description: Type of computed rule. 'field': evaluates a single field's answer (requires fieldName, subtype, correctAnswer, points). 'aggregate': calculates total score from field rules and assigns grade (requires inputFields, evaluationRules with percentage-based conditions).

fieldName.description: Full path to the target field using dot notation (e.g., 'groupName.questionName'). Required for type='field'.

subtype.description: Evaluation subtype for type='field'. exactMatch: value must equal correctAnswer exactly. arrayMatch: for multi-select fields (tagbox). numericMatch: allows tolerance for numbers. keywordMatch: checks for required/optional keywords in text.

correctAnswer.description: Expected correct answer for type='field' rules. Type depends on field: string for text/radio, array for tagbox, number for numeric fields.

partialCredit.description: Allow partial credit for partially correct answers

inputFields.description: Field paths to include in score aggregation (required for type='aggregate'). These should match the fieldName values from your type='field' rules. Example: ['basics.q1', 'basics.q2', 'advanced.q3']

categoryMapping.description: Mapping of field names to category names

condition.description: Condition for this evaluation rule. MUST be an object, NOT a string! For percentage-based scoring use format: { "percentage": ["operator", value] }. Example: { "percentage": [">=", 90] } means 90% or higher score. Valid operators: ==, !=, >, <, >=, <=. DO NOT use string format like 'score >= 90'.

result.description: Result label/grade to assign when condition is met (e.g., 'Excellent', 'Pass', 'Fail')

message.description: Feedback message to display when this evaluation rule matches

evaluationRules.description: Evaluation rules for aggregate scoring (used when type='aggregate'). Each rule defines a condition based on percentage score, a result label, and a feedback message. Rules are evaluated in order - first matching rule wins. Example rule: { "condition": { "percentage": [">=", 90] }, "result": "Excellent", "message": "Great job!" }
